articleinfo.title: The Linux Documentation Project Weekly News

sect1.title: New documents @ The LDP
sect1.para: This week brings us, once again, a new addition to our collection:

listitem.para: Venkata Ramana Enaganti finalized the Autofdir HOWTO, which explains about autofs and how it can be used to create directories in a transparent manner. It also details the disadvantage of using the pam_mkhomedir module, as well as where it is different from autofs.
Miroslav Skoric updated his trio, to note the FBB Packet-radio BBS mini-HOWTO, the LILO mini-HOWTO and the Linux+WindowsNT mini-HOWTO.
Ryan Cartwright sent in an updated for the Windows LAN server HOW-TO, which fixes outdated references.
WordPerfect for Linux continues to be popular, and is still conditionally available. Consequently, Rick Moen keeps his WordPerfect on Linux FAQ up to date.
AJ Lewis has updates on LVM2 and on how to move a diskgroup to another system in his http://tldp.org/HOWTO/LVM-HOWTO/.
Christoph Baumann contributed his Linux Touch Screen HOWTO under the GNU Free Documentation License.

sect1.title: HOWTO contribute to The LDP
sect1.para: The Linux Documentation Project (TLDP) is working on developing free, high quality documentation for the GNU/Linux operating system. If you want to help TLDP, consider joining discuss-subscribe@en.tldp.org.

Help us create this newsletter. We need volunteers who follow the community (mailing lists, newsgroups, web channels) and report events related to free software documentation. Write to us at feedback@en.tldp.org.
The LDP Weekly News is compiled and edited by Machtelt Garrels and Y Giridhar Appaji Nag with help from several other people.
